tldr: This article discusses the evolution and adaptation of pterodactyls, ancient flying reptiles. It examines their unique skeletal structure, which allowed them to be efficient and agile fliers. The author also explores the differences between early pterodactyls with tails and those without, as well as the possible methods of flight used by these creatures. The article provides insights into how pterodactyls lived and functioned, offering a fascinating look at these extinct animals and their place in the history of life on Earth.
